contents.title: Welcome to GameDay!
text: This is a cross-platform web-tool designed to help gamers simplify their games and they interact with their games.

I made this with the intention of using it for Grand Theft Auto Online cars and such. With five garages and nearly 40 cars, I kept forgetting which car was which and why I owned a car; back when we could only have 20 it was much easier to remember each individual car.

The beauty of GameDay is that it requires no setup and runs completely in a browser; no need to compile or interpret any code– JS (ES7). An individual could develop a generator or preview for GameDay.
On New Years Eve (Sunday December 31, 2017) GameDay was ported over to Electron.

contents.title: Development
text: Development of GameDay began on Thursday December 21, 2017 with the intention of having a public alpha by New Years Day (Monday January 1, 2018). The JS(ON) layout idea was the basis of the Proton Platform.
The following protons are available: textbox, list.

contents.title: Inspiration
text: The idea and design stems from Microsoft's intranet solution: SharePoint. At my day-job I am a SharePoint designer; I create, modify, and supervise the use and implementation of SharePoint.
